Live transaction risk scoring based on machine learning models
Instant flagging of high-risk transactions for manual review
Customizable fraud detection rules (e.g., transaction limits, velocity checks)
AI-based behavioral analysis to detect deviations from normal user activity
Alerts for rapid or repetitive transactions within short time frames
AI assigns risk scores to every transaction based on:
High-risk transactions are automatically flagged for admin approval
AI learns user spending patterns and detects deviations
Identification of device fingerprinting mismatches (e.g., multiple accounts from the same device/IP)
Detection of suspicious login behavior (e.g., multiple failed login attempts, logins from different geolocations)
AI detects unusual login attempts and enforces additional authentication (OTP, biometric)
Adaptive authentication based on user risk profile
Flagging of newly registered accounts making large transactions
Detection of accounts making transactions across unrelated geographies
Alerts for multiple failed KYC attempts
AI predicts high-risk transactions likely to result in chargebacks
Automatic flagging of suspicious refunds and chargeback attempts
AI cross-checks transactions against global sanctions and watchlists
Monitoring of large transactions against anti-money laundering (AML) thresholds
Automatic suspicious activity reports (SARs) for regulatory compliance
Continuous improvement of fraud detection models based on new fraud trends
Self-learning AI that refines detection accuracy over time
Automated classification of fraud types (e.g., phishing, identity theft, money laundering)
AI-generated reports on fraud trends, risk levels, and flagged transactions
Dashboard for tracking real-time fraud attempts and resolution status
Visual analytics for admin decision-making (graphs, heat maps of fraud-prone regions)
